alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 21 at 3:00AM PST until January 22 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong north to east winds through Saturday... .North to east winds will increase across interior Northern California today. The strongest winds in the Central Valley will occur this afternoon into Saturday morning, while strongest winds over the northern Sierra and southern Cascades are expected tonight and Saturday. Gusts of 35 to 45 mph will be possible in the Central Valley, and gusts over 50 mph are likely across the higher elevations and exposed ridges in the northern Sierra. The most significant impacts are expected in the mountains where downed trees and power outages will be possible along with difficult driving conditions. ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Northeast winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 50 to 70 mph expected. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to noon PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Strong winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs and weakened treas could be blown down and power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Avoid forested areas as strong wind gusts will blow down trees and branches. Stay clear of power lines. Secure outdoor objects.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
